data.title: Food so-so, ambience and service good
data.text: Went on a Friday night, game weekend. The wait was 45 minutes and they set you up in an app which is nice because you can walk around. The hostess was very nice. Likewise, our waitress was friendly and accommodating. We started with calamari as that is my 9 yo son's go to. He wouldn't touch it-very chewy and the oil was obviously old as the color was too dark. The menu didn't seem to have many lighter options, the vast majority of the dishes feature a cream sauce. We ended up getting a large salad and the Capri signature dish which was cheese tortellini  with crab and a pesto cream sauce. I don't know why any  restaurant would have their signature dish feature crab with imitation, but this is fault for ordering this in Bryan when we had been in napa the weekend before. So, overall, cute spot, nice atmosphere, good people, stick with something basic like spaghetti.

data.title: Nice dinner in Aggieland!
data.text: Caffe' Capri is a unique, charming option for dinner in a sea of chain restaurants.  The service was good, the food was delicious and the prices reasonable.  It looked like it really gets busy on Fridays, but they took reservations, which was helpful to our party of 5.  Lots of charm throughout the restaurant -- check it out!

data.title: Basic Italian dishes at reasonable prices.
data.text: This restaurant is right in center of downtown Bryan. Convenient for downtown business or shopping. The menu is a bit limited, but the prices are good.

data.title: Excellent as usual
data.text: We love eating here. The food is always outstanding and the so is the service. The manager is usually floating around to check on everything, and the staff is knowledgable and eager to please. We come here for our anniversary dinner every summer.

data.title: Rehearsal Dinner
data.text: Wonderful evening spent at Caffe Capri.  The staff was very helpful in arranging our event and took very good care of our 38 guests.  The food was amazing and many expressed how much they enjoyed the meal.  I would highly recommend Caffe Capri.

data.title: Food borders on ok however the ambiance is nice and the service is good
data.text: I thought the food was unimpressive and the taste rather benign. All the staff is nice, however, and the ambiance is pleasant. It wouldn't take much to make this good food-wise but for now it's below average.

data.title: So romantic so delicious
data.text: Best Italian in the Brazos Valley! Try the Cajun fettuccine! This down town building is so quaint. You might need to make a reservation.

data.title: Great Italian w/o a Great Price
data.text: We frequented Cafe Capri from the time Rami Cerone opened it and have seen it grow both in menu and best of all in quality.  The prices are well within the medium range and the quantity and quality are outstanding.  Lunch is the best bargain in BCS.

data.title: They food is ok
data.text: The food is OK chicken Caesar salad is what I get all the time it is really good. What keeps me coming back is the customer service most of the time I call in my order and pick it up for lunch they know what I want before I even say my name always greeted with a smile.

data.title: Fantastic Italian
data.text: We ate here at lunch time, the place was very nice. The food was wonderful, really brought out the Italian experience. We will for sure make this a stop in Bryan again.

data.title: Nice place.
data.text: My wife and I have been wanting to try this place and when we finally fid, it was with it. It's a small location and doesn't seat a lot of people, but if you can get in it is a rather nice place and a welcome change of pace.

data.title: Chocolate cake to die for!
data.text: Amazing, relaxing atmosphere. The food is always wonderful! Save room for dessert, the chocolate cake and tiramisu are so good!

data.title: Great Italian
data.text: Visited with a friend, who goes frequently. Never ordered anything on the menu that he didn't like. I had the Cajun tortelloni. It was excellent. The sauce was so creamy, with just the right amount of spice/bite. The pasta and sausage both excellent. And we had cheesecake for dessert. All definitely worth eating and visiting again.

data.title: Excellent Service!
data.text: Although it was very crowded with a wait list, we got great service and the food was delicious. I was with the family (6) and each of us enjoyed our meal. Our server, Malerie, had a constant beautiful smile even though we kept bugging her about bringing us more and more hot bread which was delicious. Rami, the owner was making his rounds to make sure customers were happy. Would definitely go back and recommend.

data.title: A pasta house, NOT an Italian restaurant
data.text:
Caffe Capri is very popular locally, and has a following. I'm not part of that following. The space is fantastic...old, historic, tin roof, comfortable and classy ambiance. The service is perfectly fine and the staff are nice.

The food is forgettable, consisting largely of big bowls of pasta in different cream sauces. The salads are uninspired. The wine list is very "meh." That's honestly all I can say, and I've been here at the request of others quite a few times. The sign on the wall says "I love carbs!" and, well, if you do, you can fill up on pasta and bread here for at least a reasonable price. Not my thing, but another symptom of the strangely mediocre "Italian" food in BCS...a community with a historic Italian presence.

data.title: Nice stop for lunch
data.text: Nice clean friendly place. The prices are good and the food is great. If your out shopping in old town Bryan I would recommend stopping in for a bit.

data.title: nice enough and good atmosphere
data.text:
Friendly little Italian place in the revitalized downtown Bryan area.  Parking and access is easy.  The restaurant is in an old renovated Main St. building, high stamped-tim ceilings and whatnot.

Staff are young people, very friendly.  Quality of service was very good, the waitress brought water for everyone at her suggestion to give us a little more time to peruse the menu.

The fare is basic Italian, our selections ranged from the lasagna to the chicken Parmesan to the seafood ravioli.  All of the choices were well received and tasty, they were freshly prepared, if a little too safely bland.  The place seems to be popular with the younger college and just-out-of-college demographic.  

All in all an OK experience, the food was done to a good standard, but slightly unimaginative - but this might be a requirement of the location and clientele.  We would come here again if we were after pasta and didn't want to have to think too hard about it.

data.title: Meh...
data.text: Kind of a nice place but the food is pretty indifferent. If you think Olive Garden is good, then go here and it is much better. On the other hand if you know real italian food, then give up on B/CS because it isn't around.

data.title: Great Italian restaurant
data.text: This is a quiet place to find in downtown Bryan.  Small place so you might want to make a reservation to ensure you can get in.  Good is always good and service is excellent.  A must visit place.

data.title: Areas best Italian
data.text: Cozy and artsy atmosphere, and quiet enough for easy conversation. The staff have always been friendly and efficient. Offers the best eggplant parmesan and cannoli I've ever eaten!
